website_summaries.verdict: Uses multiple auto dimming sensors to determine the proper shade setting. Has a wide viewing area.
pros: Uses an auto darkening filter so welders can match the shade of the lens to the environment in which they're working
Viewing area measures 3.93 inches by 2.36 inches
Complies with both ANSI and CSA standards
Trusted brand name among welding helmets and safety products
cons: Helmet may feel too tight for some people, making it uncomfortable at times

customer_reviews.title: Great hood for hobbyists or professionals.
customer_reviews.text: Use every day as a structural welder and ironworker, and it's a great hood for the price. Clear visibility, love the grind mode. Only reason it's not 5 stars is because the headgear likes to come loose every now and then (usually at the most inopportune time) and while it's a quick fix, it's annoying nonetheless. Great hood otherwise. And don't listen to the people who say the chin is too high, they obviously haven't realized there is a 4 position height adjustment on both sides of the hood.
customer_reviews.author: Master Plebian of the Universe

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet!
customer_reviews.text: I am comparing this against the cheap Kobalt helmet from Loews. For just over a hundred bucks you can’t ask for more. I have had a few 50 - 100 dollar helmets from local big box stores like Loews and Home Depot. Jackson gets you to such a better level for around the same amount of money. Been hobby welding for years and I finally bought a good helmet after flashing my eyes from a failing Kobalt helmet. I would recommend this if you’re in the 100 dollar range.
customer_reviews.author: John DeMarchi

customer_reviews.title: Small and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The only good thing about this unit is the lens. In fact, the lens and all the controls for the auto-dimming are impressive to say the least. But that’s where the pros about this unit stop. Onto the cons: The plastic is really flimsy, it’s too small for a respirator, and the jaw-line is too short, to where sparks can easily go down your shirt. I’d consider spending a couple extra bucks and buying a higher quality helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Welds like a dream
customer_reviews.text: this is the best purchase ive ever made, no lie. this is the first auto darken helmet iv'e ever owned and i have not been dissapointed. controls are easy, welds like a dream, turns off/on automatically. if there is one bad thing i could say about this helmet is that my hair does get caught in the hinges if i weld without a bandanna, that being said i do sport an afro every part of the year its not too hot for it. you will never regret buying this helmet.
customer_reviews.author: C.S

customer_reviews.title: Junk, brittle and not sturdy, not meant for work.
customer_reviews.text: Finally decided to buy a nicer helmet and received a cheap piece of junk build worse than your average harbor freight welding helmet..... Cracked first day and I didn't even notice until later the seccond day. The headgear is TRASH the snaps on the heat top do not snap so I had to tape it. Something about buting a Brand New helmet that's over a hundred bucks and by the seccond day it already has multiple spots with tape on it doesn't seem right.
customer_reviews.author: RICK A

customer_reviews.title: Best value for precision work
customer_reviews.text: The only minus is sensitivity. I was doing some abrasive cutoff wheel work slitting a 3/4 bar of stainless. Sparks down, it still went into dark mode with min sensitivity. So I taped over the sensors. Now for welding? The best I've used. Perfect fit, huge window and excellent shade control. Most of my work is low current GTAW. Autogeneous thin sheet in programmed spot mode. Zero eye fatigue. This isn't a pipeline SMAW hood. Its lightweight, precision GTAW style.
customer_reviews.author: Keith J.

customer_reviews.title: Blue like hue
customer_reviews.text: The lens on this hood is really good compared to others. I think they upgraded it because I have the same hood at work which seems a lot more green. Other hoods I have used are more green and this one seems like it has some blue tint to it. Very clear field of view. Like others said, the shell isn't the best. My work hood cracked at the bottom. Also, the top head strap adjustment never stays put. I want to switch it out with a different one. Lens is nice though.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: flimsy helmet material
customer_reviews.text: Been welding 50+ yrs. This helmet is made of Tupperware material = flexible (does not work nicely when handling) The more rigid fiberglass or rigid cardstock material is more suitable for a welding helmet. The headgear won't stay in place (pivot on left side keeps getting loose, helmet comes down too often and at bad times!) The good part of headgear is the large dial for tightening the headband - very easy to use with gloved hands!
customer_reviews.author: Weldman69

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this helmet. It is flexible enough to wear my double cartridge respirator under it. I have to flex it to fit. I was welding 3 forged copper bars together using electrical ground wire, as the welding rod, and Helium as the inert gas. The only problem is to the head gear. The adjusting knobs won't stay tight and I had to put tape on the adjustable head sizing part. All easier fixed. I would recommend purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got here fast! Used today in sculpture class. Worked perfectly for grinding and welding with mig! :)
customer_reviews.author: eliphillips2013

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this helmet and the filter too
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this helmet and the filter too. The filter is the better of the two. It has a nice variety of shades and the grind mode. What I don't like about this helmet though, is that it is pretty flimsy. After just 2 months it already broke in the chin area after a lousy drop. It's not like I slammed it or anything. Just a lousy drop. Anyways the headgear sits nice on my head and blah blah. Its a good set up, Jackson is a good brand love em but I prefer the hsl100 over this helmet because it's not as flimsy it is more sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Jackie R.

customer_reviews.title: Great hood for the $$$$
customer_reviews.text: Good helmet for the price.i weld everyday as a ironworker and it works. As far as the comments about the good not dropping low enough clearly don’t realize there is a 4 height adjustment pin,when you get it it’s at the highest setting causing that. Just drop to the 3rd hole on the adjustment and it’s perfect. Headgear is good stays on in wind and doesn’t give me a headache from having to crank it down like some other brands. I wouldn’t hesitate to buy this again if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waaaay better than my old helmets.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this helmet when talking to my local welding supply shop. They had sold out, so I decided to purchase it on Amazon... I actually stopped welding until i could purchase a proper helmet, my old helmet would fail or a sensor wouldn't pick up the arc, flashing my eyes....This helmet has worked perfectly for me as a hobbyist..worked flawlessly from the start....my old helmets are now in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewKse

customer_reviews.title: Oh yeah
customer_reviews.text: Welding for 15 years and this helmet is nice. I've had some more expensive helmets but I lime this one. It has a comfortable strap for your head and the display is digital. I weld dual shield 1/16 wire and 27 volts 300 wire speed and she holds up great. Grind mode at a push of a button shade 4. Jackson is old school so that oughtta tell you something
customer_reviews.author: TransAm84

customer_reviews.title: Nice safety equipment
customer_reviews.text: Was worried a bit about how well the auto darkening would work, and the answer is excellently! Compared to the always on dumb gear, where you are tempted to slide it in after, the hands free full view, on and off is sooooo much better. Only problem I’ve had is a bit of fogging if I’m under it a bit too long, but not a fault of the mask.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet.
customer_reviews.text: For home use or light industrial, this thing is perfect. The headstrap is deeper than the cheapies, and better made. The hood itself is kind of flimsy, but it's also very light. I'm sure that with a little care, it'll outlast me.
customer_reviews.author: HiWayRay

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great helmet for the money. It’s comfortable and well made. The sensor on the bottom of the view window is a huge plus over cheaper helmets. I’ve used the comparable Miller and Hobart helmets and this beats them both!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: very flimsy , material too thin hood breaks very soon after purchase
customer_reviews.text: The hood is very flimsy for the money it compares to $40.00 helmets from harbor freight . I would never buy again. over priced for the poor quality . The hood cracked like an egg shell.
customer_reviews.author: dennis lucero

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price! I had a cheap welding helmet and when it quit working it would flash me before darkening. I decided to buy a quality one since eyes are important. First bead I laid down looked as good as anything I’d done in a long while because I could actually see! If I break this, I’ll be back for another
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best hood for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it better be good, and honestly it really is. Everything down to the lenses (outside and inside) is perfect. This thing is used and abused for almost a month now, and it is flawless. I use this for 8-12 hours on and off, batteries are perfect (it stays charged) and has held up to hours and hours of grinding and welding. The head strap is the most comfortable I have used and that’s coming from someone whose bought miller and Lincoln units, this hood is the absolute best for the price. I will buy this again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality not Chinese crap.
customer_reviews.text: Best hood ive ever had used it day in day out for a while, aways works.
customer_reviews.author: b-rent

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price works great
customer_reviews.text: Works fine I've been MIG welding for 8 hours a days mon-fri since July. Hasn't let me down. Can't believe I've been using the Stone age one. What a difference this makes when your starting and stopping. The sensitivity and delay are good features as well. I'd definitely buy another and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: nicole wright

customer_reviews.title: Great welding/grinding helmet but it isn't made from a hard plastic, the shell is a little soft and plyable.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, multiple settings including grinding mode for dimming the glass while grinding, but it wont be too dark to see what you're doing. I wish the helmet was made of something a bit more sturdy (it's a soft plastic/hard rubber) but everything else is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Insight auto darkening display is great.
customer_reviews.text: Insight digital display is great, the hood is junk, very cheap. I took the Insight out and placed it in my old Jackson non-auto darkening hood due to I needed a hood now not later and didn't feel like dealing with the hassle of sending it back. Insight auto darkening display is great the actual hood is cheap and very disappointing, a tad shocking for Jackson.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Really nice helmet, but the shell is a bit thin in the chin area.
customer_reviews.text: Works good and the adjustments, both mechanical and darkness levels all work well. The helmet is nice and light, but maybe a bit too thin in the area by the chin. This tends to be where you grab it to lift up or off and mine generated a small crack in the this area. I drilled the end of the crack to stop it from growing and made a stick on reinforcement strip to add some strength in this area.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: The product it self is good, but the packaging was bad to be honest. There were no protection for the product it self. Three star for the product. Zero start for the packaging and it was not closed.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Radwani

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy plastic but works well.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used it a few times and it works well. Like others have said, the plastic is very thin and flexible. Makes my $30 Harbor Freight hood seem heavy duty. Overall, I’m satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great performance for the price
customer_reviews.text: I use this hood mostly for exhaust work so lots of overhead, so far has worked great. Primary complaint is that the headgear pulls my hair...ouch
customer_reviews.author: GearHead

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this helmet!
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Lightweight, good viewing area, no flashing. It even has a Grind Mode! For the features and price point I couldn't beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Next Level

customer_reviews.title: Buy this Helmet!
customer_reviews.text: What’s not to love? This thing is amazing. Best welding helmet I have ever owned by far... I will never be able to go back to a cheap $40 helmet again
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great hood
customer_reviews.text: Awesome hood, I am a professional tig welder and have used many hoods, for the price you can’t beat this hood. It light, comfortable, and crystal clear. If you’re on the fence make the jump before they raise the price!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Seems flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Has a light green color to it. Light shade seems more like a shade 4 than shade 3. Feels very flimsy but for about $100 it should last a little while in a professional production environment.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan C.

customer_reviews.title: Good for home but not work.
customer_reviews.text: Shell is a little thin and is already cracked, spent a little extra and get one with a better shell. I bought for work but would have been fine for home use.
customer_reviews.author: C. Klug

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy but useful
customer_reviews.text: The helmet shell is so flimsy it felt like a toy. I actually pulled the guts of this and put it in my older Jackson helmet as it was more of a firm helmet. All is good now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris N.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: It isn't worth the price. The mask itself is very cheaply made and be easily scratched. The only good thing about it is the lens and adjustment head band. I've had it for a month and I already have to replace the outer lens
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Good device
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Good visibility. Works with low amperage tig mAchines. No flashes. Head gear is adjustable enough. Lightweight structure is a little floppy but I don't mind it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Urry

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered for my husband! He loves it. Loves the auto adjust and fits comfortably!
customer_reviews.author: erika allen

customer_reviews.title: Bought this and my eyes have never been so happy. Do yourself a favor and don't wait till ...
customer_reviews.text: Oh my God I was welding with a harbor freight helmet for a long time. Bought this and my eyes have never been so happy. Do yourself a favor and don't wait till you see spots. Buy a decent welding helmet
customer_reviews.author: lloyd frers

customer_reviews.title: Jackson has the best value on the market
customer_reviews.text: Jackson has the best headgear on the market. The unit is always on. The operation is simple. The viewing area is great. It makes my $250 Miller mask look like junk.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Helmet
customer_reviews.text: Nice design, works well, good viewing field, step up from my old helmet
customer_reviews.author: babo45

customer_reviews.title: Great for mig and stick
customer_reviews.text: I like the helmet but it does flicker when trying to use it for tig welding steel
customer_reviews.author: Kevin w.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one it came in defective returned that one and received another and that was defective
customer_reviews.author: KAREN SALLESE

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Gift for grandson who is taking welding courses. My son who is a welder was impressed with the helmet and the grandson loves it. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Hassell

customer_reviews.title: Solid hood.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hood. I wouldn't use it for overhead stick or flux core. But for everything else I really can't complain. Almost a year of hard use and the head gear is still functioning flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnar7.62

customer_reviews.title: I use it at work
customer_reviews.text: Operates flawlessly, I only wish it would have come with a helmet bag. But the price is a total steal for the quality of safety. So many helmets are ridiculously expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My bf loved it for his birthday present. He said it's so nice and perfect for his welding.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: Have used Jackson product for over 55 years and as always performs well and priced right.
customer_reviews.author: Don Johnson

customer_reviews.title: safety first
customer_reviews.text: Use mine at least 2 times a week. Its a great hood for the money and would definitely buy it again!

customer_reviews.title: Great helmet for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Helmet has worked great for all types of welding. Lightweight and easy to adjust. Hard to beat a Jackson helmet.
customer_reviews.author: MIke

customer_reviews.title: bedding
customer_reviews.text: very comfortable and was a perfect match for our new home
customer_reviews.author: Angela Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome helmet. Better than expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome helmet. Better than expected for the price. Would get another.
customer_reviews.author: Daren

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Needed a good quality item at the right price, found it on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Commodore

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: This is a good value. proves you don't need to spend $300 for a good auto dark
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product...!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst piece of crap I have ever purchased on Amazon!!! Shame on you...!
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Barbas

customer_reviews.title: Light
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light. My first hood so I cant make an expert comment.
customer_reviews.author: Beau W.

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this helmet so far
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this helmet so far. It seems to work well for my needs. Please note that this is my first auto darkening helmet so I am far from an expert user. Packaging was very good. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen T.

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: greatproduct great price i didnt know what i was missing when i was using a cheap hood
customer_reviews.author: Markyo

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional welder and this shield is a great value for the money. It performs reliably and is comfortable to wear. The ratcheting head gear holds well. The shell seems a little flimsy, but hasn't been an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Kitto

customer_reviews.title: Really good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This hood is worth every bet of the cost. I use it all the time I weld
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Peck

customer_reviews.title: Great out of position welding hood
customer_reviews.text: Great hood for out of position welding since its so light. It also locks tightly in the upright position. So you can walk around with your hood up and it won't fall down.
customer_reviews.author: andrew palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed, works great, light any fully adjustable
customer_reviews.author: G. E. Busby

customer_reviews.title: Great Helmet
customer_reviews.text: Great Helmet, I replaced my old Jackson welding helmet of 20 plus years.
customer_reviews.author: Albert G.

customer_reviews.title: Love how's the modes example grind sensitivity are set up
customer_reviews.text: I am a Apprentice welder at my grandfather's shop. I use this Hood all the time. For the price you can't beat the visual quality
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.text: Not as good of quality as my last one .
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good price good quality but.......
customer_reviews.text: This my first auto darkening hood and so far so good for the price and the features work as they should my only complaint is that the overall width of the shell is quite narrow the edges of my ears are exposed but not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Good middle of the road helmet.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for stick, mig, and tig. Adjustments all work well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need to find a hard hat adapter
customer_reviews.text: Love the helmet but does not fit the hard hat adapter. I have a Fibre Metal Halo, is there a hard hat adapter that this helmet will fit?
customer_reviews.author: Steven e.

customer_reviews.title: Good Helmet
customer_reviews.text: Works well for hobby welding. And that is all I need.

customer_reviews.title: Buy one
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been welding for 35yrs , this is a very good hood , I like it

customer_reviews.title: Jackson Safety electronic look’s very good but the helmet itself is so cheap
customer_reviews.text: Jackson Safety electronic look’s very good but the helmet itself is so cheap, soft scrap, I am extremely deceived, my expectation was much higher from a well-known company like that
customer_reviews.author: Michel Arseneau

customer_reviews.title: great item and purchase
customer_reviews.text: no arc accidents like i had before, sensors do thier job new, fit adj. is new and nice

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a dream compared to the torture device HF hood ...
customer_reviews.text: Feels like a dream compared to the torture device HF hood I was using. Very easy to use interface and the view is great.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this helmet. Its made well and I can see very well with it. Good Value!!

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It’s badass literally the best I have owned personally. Clear view. One down side I will note is that it does feel slightly flimsy. But over all happy.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary H.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when you take the bracket out that hold the auto darkening in it will brake
customer_reviews.text: Great helmet love it clear view comfortable head gear and everything inside is very easy to use

customer_reviews.text: Auto darkening is great, shell and head suspension is cheaply made.

customer_reviews.text: Love the hood , works perfect and it arrived on time . I have had Jackson hoods for year's and loved them all

customer_reviews.text: Love it so far it works the way it is supposed to.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Really good helmet didn’t give five stars because i feel it should have came with lenses to replace the one it has

customer_reviews.title: Bam welding hood
customer_reviews.text: Used it a few times. It works and does the job.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I use it on the daily and it gets the job done

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good fit, easy to use, good field of view with magnification lens Cons: The fact that I need a magnifying lens!

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Burnt my eyes really bad the first day but overall a good helmet

customer_reviews.text: This item was for my husband. He works on his old Chevy truck on weekends welds at times. He says this helmet is badass his words. 😂.

customer_reviews.title: then it's a good hood.
customer_reviews.text: Do not use in a shipyard because it will break the first week otherwise you're in a shop out of elements moving slow and calm,maybe in the union, then it's a good hood.

customer_reviews.text: I bought this welding helmet because of some reviews stating it was made in the USA, not !!! According the box that it came in the helmet and headgear are made in Vietnam and the lens is made it China, when are the US manufacturers going to get it ? I should return it but I will post this review for those like myself that want to buy USA made items...

product_meta.title: Jackson Safety Ultra-Lightweight Insight Variable Auto Darkening Filter Welding Helmet, Nylon, Halo X, Black, Universal Size, 46131
product_meta.description: Size:1 Welding HelmetThis Jackson Safety Ultra-Lightweight Insight Welding Helmet is built with four auto dimming sensors with easy-to-use controls, positioned to reduce possibility of blockage during welding. This ADF helmet has a viewing area of 3.93" x 2.36" and offers an un-obstructive view during all stages of the welding process, without lifting the hood. With variable shades from 9 to 13, this helmet has sensitivity and delay adjustments for different tasks and durations, enabling welders to adapt to various working environments by controlling the shade of the lens. Jackson Safety W40 INSIGHT Variable Auto Darkening Welding Helmet is compatible with the HLX100 and HSL 100 shells, meets ANSI Z87.1+ standards and is CSA compliant. Established in 1933, Jackson Safety has built a century long reputation for delivering the most innovative safety solutions in the welding and personal protective equipment industries. When it comes to providing safety solutions with long-lasting value, durability and comfort, Jackson Safety has set the standard. Whether the need is for welding protection in a steel fabrication environment, head protection on a construction site, or hearing protection at an airport, Jackson Safety provides the widest range of safety choices to meet the needs of every job and every worker.
feature_bullets: Features: This Jackson Safety Ultra-Lightweight Insight Welding Helmet is built with four auto dimming sensors with easy-to-use controls, positioned to reduce possibility of blockage during welding
Design: This ADF helmet has a viewing area of 3.93" x 2.36" and offers an un-obstructive view during all stages of the welding process, without lifting the hood

Clean View: With variable shades from 9 to 13, this helmet has sensitivity and delay adjustments for different tasks and durations, enabling welders to adapt to various working environments by controlling the shade of the lens
Gives you the compliance you're looking for, since it meets ANSI Z87.1+ standards and is CSA compliant
